property.name: text
property.value:
This model demonstrates the difference between multi-observer particle filtering and individual outputs of local particle filters.
The controllers keep robots 1 and 2 stationary, at [10,0] and [-10,0], respectively. The target is stationary at [0,5].
In the case of individual particle filtering, where each particle filter uses a measurement from a single robot, a particle set, corresponding to annulus around the robot, whose mean radius is equal to the instantaneous measurement made by the robot, is produced.
In the case of joint particle filtering, the particle filter has access to the measurement streams of both robots. A particle is weighted in this case, according to its likelihood under the joint distribution determined by the two robots' measurements. Under the commonly valid assumption that robot measurements are conditionally independent given the target state, the particle likelihood simply becomes the product of the individual likelihoods of the measurement, under the particle assumption.

entity.name: Gaussian
entity.doc: Create a sequence of gaussian random variables
